Judul: IN VITRO ANTHELMINTHIC ACTIVITY OF PIPER BETLE L., PIPER NIGRUM, AND PIPER SARMENTOSUM ROXB. ON ASCARIS SUUM
Abstrak:
Ascariasis is a type of disease that is caused by Ascaris lumbricoides. It was estimated that it infects
up to 1.2 billion of population in the world. It can cause some serious complications such as
pulmonary hypersensitivity, anemia, etc. The objective of this in-vitro study is to determine the
anthelminthic activity of Piperaceae (P. betle L., P. nigrum, P. sarmentosum Roxb.) against Ascaris
suum. The concentration of the plant extract used was 10mg/mL and 50mg/mL for each of the plant.
The worms was placed inside a petri dish containing the tested extract and the time taken of paralysis
was observed every 30 minutes as well as the type of paralysis. All of the plant extracts showed a
significant anthelminthic activity against Ascaris suum. The time taken to flaccid paralysis that was
observed for 10mg/mL of P. betle L., P. nigrum, and P. sarmentosum Roxb. was 7.0 ± 0.4082 hours,
5.50 ± 0.7071 hours, and 7.875 ± 0.25 hours respectively. Whereas for 50mg/mL, the time taken to
flaccid paralysis was 4.5 ± 0.7071 hours, 4.00 ± 0.4082 hours, and 4.875 ± 0.4787 hours for P. betle L.,
P. nigrum, and P. sarmentosum Roxb. respectively. Based on this study, it can be concluded that all
of the plant extracts (P. betle L., P. nigrum, P. sarmentosum Roxb.) possess an anthelminthic activity
against A. suum. All the extracts have significant difference compared to control negative. However,
the effect is not as good as pyrantel pamoate as reference group.
